he: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ בָּעֵינַן וְדֵן אוֹ לָא בָּעֵינַן וְדֵן
text: § A dilemma was raised before them: Do we need to write: And this that you shall have from me is a scroll of divorce, and a letter of leave, and a bill of dismissal to go to marry any man that you wish, or do we not need to write the clause beginning with the words: And this? Is the halakha in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda or the Rabbis?
